reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports to the Security Council within 11 months of the adoption of this resolution
summary:
25. The Council acknowledges recommendations and guidance provided by the IMO on preventing and suppressing piracy.
The Security Council:

 Urges collaboration with shipping and insurance industries, IMO to develop best practices to counter piracy off Somalia's coast and for States to make citizens and vessels available for forensic investigation.

 Encourages flag and port States to develop safety and security measures on board vessels, including regulations for Private Contracted Armed Security Personnel (PCASP).

 Invites IMO to continue contributing to preventing and suppressing piracy, coordinating with UNODC, WFP, and shipping industry.

 Notes the importance of securing WFP assistance delivery by sea, welcoming work by WFP, EU operation ATALANTA, and flag States on Vessel Protection Detachments.

 Requests States and regional organizations to report to the Security Council and Secretary-General within 9 months on progress in exercising authorizations to fight piracy.

 Requests the Secretary-General to report within 11 months on implementation and the situation with respect to piracy off Somalia's coast.

 Expresses intention to review the situation and consider renewing authorizations for additional periods upon Somali authority's request.

 Decides to remain seized of the matter.
